return moduleData;

updateData.data:
SELECT * FROM module_version 
JOIN module ON (module_version.module_name = module.module_name)
WHERE module_version.npm_url IS NOT NULL OR module_version.npm_name IS NOT NULL

SELECT * FROM module_version 
INNER JOIN module ON (module_version.module_name = module.module_name) 
WHERE module_version.es_url IS NOT NULL

Handling the conditional execution of the "create module" query. Lacking that, I will make a separate query so the user must manually create a module entry.
Cleaning up a failure in the second action - create module version entry and save file data. Lacking that I will just leave the error.

I need to get a permanent URL for the repository. I don't want to change the links - modules.apogeejs.com?
For starters, I have no real server, even if this is the code. My plan is to run this temporarily. I also want the service to run on static files.
I'll run off off github only for initial testing. I will switch to netlify so other people can use it with the final URL. Before this goes public I will make a real service that processing inputs.
For now, I want to allow two distinct requests - npm and es modules.
Later, I will also want to alter the response based on the version of the app requesting.

Server Design for Static Site Generation
The server will populate the file system and the sqlite database
I will have a process to call the server and generate the request files. Probably an apogee workspace

An issue for transitioning the server is that the module request file needs to list the url. And ideally this would be a constant. But we can't do that with our server migration plan. Options for hadling the URL:
I can define a relative url in the file, and the program can use that. BUT I really do want a single real url.
In the server, set it to a constant url, whatever will be the place from which it is accessed. So initially I would set it to github. And you couldn't access the file from the local location.
I could make a conversion of the host in the workspace that generates the request tile.
I could pass a dummy param in that tells what the hosting server is for the files
I'll do all three that are not grayed out.
